The classification system is actually meant to diversify the champions which were already incredibly broad in the first place. 

Juggernauts win long fights through attrition, tanks lock down and peel in long fights. 

And you may not care, but it's how Riot is moving forward so don't expect Mundo to be balanced around being a tank. Expect him to be balanced around being a juggernaut.

It's only a serious discussion if both sides respect the other and it's clear you won't respect me for having a different opinion. 

By your definition anyone can be a tank just by building tanky because we have items that scale off of tank stats (warmogs, IBG, Thornmail). 

As for the job of the tank: it's not just to absorb damage. That's the most simplified definition of what a tank is. Yes tanks are usually the walls of their team, but they are also the wrecking ball. 

Vanguards showcase this by being teamfight starters with their AoE and quick engage kits. They literally crash into the enemy team to cause chaos so that the enemy team is ill prepared for his team following up. 

Wardens are tanks that focus on keeping allies safe. The biggest Warden I'd Braum not just because his kit is the most literal form of the job (that freaking shield) but also how his passive stuns people at four stacks that can be applied to anyone on his team!  He's giving the carry a peeling tool. 

We also have Tahm who literally eats his carry to run away. Taric who can stun from his carry. Alistar and his freaking headbutt. 

All of these tanks are feared for their CC and utility making teamfights literal hell for the enemy. All Mundo can do is hit you and not die. **His kit only benefits himself. He's not going to save anyone from an ulting master Yi unless the dude is stupid enough to focus the big purple guy and not the squishy carry**

Wanna know why I believe this?  Because tanks are pretty much the only class I play and I can't do the same thing with a juggernaut. I need people to engage or lock down people for me in teamfights so I can hit people when I play damage classes. 

Mundo isn't going to save me from anything outside of a skill shot.

http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/game-updates/gameplay/dev-blog-classes-subclasses

These aren't some kid's made-up words, these are what riot calls their champions. Juggernaut has a specific meaning in the context of league, so it's fine to use it.

A tank and juggernaut both draw attention to themselves by punishing you hard for not focusing on them.

The difference is how they punish, among a few other small changes.

Tanks punish with hard cc, while juggernauts punish with hard cc.

Fighters combine both dmg and cc from the tanks/juggernauts, but aren't particularly good at either.

Vanguards also punish with hard cc, like tanks, but it's used more defensively rather than offensively

Divers should be a subclass, and represents the initiation capability of any champ, and is not necessarily restricted to tanks/juggernauts/fighters, but usually is anyways. Because a Mage/Diver would.. be a "issue" to say the least

Colossus is not a tank-specific mastery. It is not meant to be used only by tanks, but generally by initiator champions - vanguards and divers. 

And even then, there isn't an issue if other classes are willing to sacrifice damage from the ferocity tree if they want the extra durability.

Like all the other keystones, it's meant to be usable by most classes, decent on several, and optimal on 2 or 3.

CoTC isn't class specific, it's based on whether you have hard CC or not. 

The best users are divers and vanguards. Only a few juggernauts can use it.

You are confusing the letter of the law with the heart of the law. The purpose of juggernauts and tanks is much the same: soak up as much damage as possible and (usually) initiate for your team. One is a bit better at soaking damage while the other packs a bit more damage sure, but they still do mostly the same job. Comparing mid/late game darius and malphite they are way more similar in their jobs than comparing late game malphite or darius to riven. Unless you are talking full ap malphite.

I'm really not.  Both roles are quite capable of absorbing massive amounts of damage during fights before dying.

The main difference between tanks and fighters is how they threaten opponents:

* Fighters are primarily threats due to their damage
* Tanks are primarily threats due to their utility.
-----------------------
Using your example, Malphite's job is to initiate teamfights,  reduce the damage dealt by the enemy team and to slowly beat people to death.  While he has damage, his primary threat is his utility (initiation, knock-up, attack speed slow).

Darius' primary job is to use his damage potential to zone and/or distract opponents.  While he has some utility (i.e. pull, slow), he is primarily a threat due to his ability to damage and kill enemy champions.
